Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer properly and fairly exercised discretion under s. 114(2) of the Immigration Act
Application_Facts: Applicant has Canadian-born children and family in Ghana; submitted materials for humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the immigration officer's decision
Court_Ruling: No reviewable error found; decision upheld
Claimant_Status: Applicant seeking permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer reviewed all submitted materials and considered relevant circumstances
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness due to lack of interview and alleged misinterpretation of facts
Legal_Standard: Discretionary power under s. 114(2); procedural fairness requires opportunity to present case, but no right to personal interview
Assessment_Factor: Presence of Canadian-born children, ties to Ghana, completeness of submitted application
Procedural_Issue: Lack of personal interview claimed as procedurally unfair
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied; no reviewable error
Evidence_Used: Submitted application materials, information about family in Canada and Ghana
Evidence_Assessed: All submitted materials were reviewed by the officer
Relief_Sought: Permanent residence status based on humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Governing_Rule: Immigration officers may grant exemptions under s. 114(2) based on H&C grounds; procedural fairness required but no entitlement to interview
Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found; applicant had opportunity to present case
Outcome: Application dismissed; no certification of serious question of general importance
Decisional_Body: Immigration officer; reviewed via judicial review
Cause_Description: Applicant sought judicial review after denial of humanitarian and compassionate application for permanent residence
Evidence_Handling: All evidence was reviewed and considered by the immigration officer
Decision_Rationale: Officer acted within discretionary authority and followed procedural fairness
Decision_Making_Body: Immigration officer under the Immigration Act
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness of administrative decision; procedural fairness
